item.description:
Organizer: Michael Blair @ 978-808-1932

=====

What we're doing

The plan is to ride at least once a week this summer - and this time we will be riding along the Nashua River Rail Trail. The Nashua River Rail Trail is a former railroad right of way that travels about 12 miles from end-to-end through the MA towns of Ayer, Groton, Pepperell and Dunstable and enters into Nashua, NH. It offers a 10-foot wide paved surface for the entire length and travels along a varied landscape, offering numerous scenic overlooks, opportunities to see wildlife and several resting stops.

=====

Trip Summary

The objective is to ride at about a 12 - 15 MPH pace. There will be two options for this trip – an 8 mile round trip and a 24 mile round trip. Both options end near Charlotte’s Cozy Kitchen so you can finish the event off with an ice cream.

We will start at the eight-mile mark of the overall route and head north to Nashua before returning to the starting point. If about eight miles is enough for you then you can end your trip here. The rest of us will continue south towards Ayer before returning to the starting point. This should be about 24 miles round trip.

Guests are not permitted - all participants must be members of the Random Group of Hikers.

While I have been on this trail many times before I did all of my current research for this trip using the Internet. You should become familiar with this information since you are ultimately responsible for your own safety.

  • Click here for information about the Nashua River Rail Trail

=====

Weather

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants a day or two before this event.

We will assess travel and weather conditions during the ride and make changes to our planned trip as necessary.

  • Click here for the current weather forecast for this trip

=====

Clothing and Equipment

Below is a list describing the minimum required clothing and equipment to participate in this event. DO NOT rely on others to share with you once we begin. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip.

  • Helmet: You must wear a properly sized and adjusted bicycle helmet that has been tested and meets the uniform safety standard issued by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC).
  • Other Essential Gear: White headlight and red taillight. A multi-purpose tool or small repair kit. A spare tube.

=====

Directions

We will begin by meeting in the dirt parking lot behind the 7-Eleven Convenience Store on the northeast side of Route 113 in Pepperell, MA. According to Google Maps this meeting spot is about 45 miles from Boston and it should take about 1 hour to drive there.

  • Click here for driving directions to the meeting spot

=====
